alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:05PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 845 PM MST... At 805 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Queen Creek, or 8 miles southeast of Gilbert, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Gilbert, Apache Junction, Queen Creek, Freestone Park, Chandler Heights, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport, San Tan Village Mall, Seville, Gold Camp and Higley. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 183 and 184. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 32 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
